This property represents a free text Description of the Output.

Tekstveld waarin de regelgeving waarop de public service gebaseerd is kan beschreven worden.

usage.nl: Gebruik bij voorkeur de relatie 'follows(Rule)' om te verwijzen naar de Vlaamse Codex. Deze property is voorzien om backwards compatible te blijven met oudere versies van IPDC.

description.nl: Tekstveld waarin uitzondering op procedures, kostprijzen, ... kunnen aangegeven worden

usage.nl: Enkel van toepassing voor public services die ontsloten worden naar YourEurope in kader van SDG (Single digital gateway)

description.nl: This property represents the status within the lifecycle of the public service (exp: creation, use or deletion of a Public Service). It doesn't refer to the status within the Public Service process.
This property represents a keyword, term or phrase to describe the Public Service.
Het type/soort van public service (bv advies, financieel voordeel, ...)
This property represents the official Name of the Public Service.
A Public Service is likely to be available only within a given area, typically the area covered by a particular public authority.
Datum waarop het object laatst gewijzigd werd
This property represents the language(s) in which the Public Service is available. This could be one language or multiple languages, for instance in countries with more than one official language.
This property represents a formally-issued Identifier for the Public Service.

This property represents a free text Description of the Public Service. The description is likely to be the text that potential users of the Public Service see in any public service catalogue. Public administrations are encouraged to include
Datum waarop het object aangemaakt werd

This property represents the Thematic Area of a Public Service as described in a controlled vocabulary, for instance social protection, health, recreation, culture and religion, family, traveling economic affairs, tax, staff, environment...

This property represents the industry or sector a Public Service relates to, or is intended for. For example: environment, safety, housing. Note that a single Public Service may relate to multiple sectors.
This class represents the legislation, policy or policies that lie behind the Rules that govern the service.

usage.nl: The definition and properties of the Legal Resource class in the CPSV-AP are aligned with the ontology included in "Council conclusions inviting the introduction of the European Legislation Identifier (ELI)".

description.nl: The Cost class represents any costs related to the execution of a Public Service that the Agent consuming it needs to pay.
This property represents a free text description of the Cost.

usage.nl: De kostprijs wordt bepaald door het lokaal bestuur

description.nl: The Evidence class is defined in the Core Criterion and Core Evidence vocabulary (CCCEV) as any resource that can document or support a response. It contains information that proves that a normal requirement exists or is true.

usage.nl: Although the wording of the definition is different, the semantics are an exact match for CPSV's Input class which it replaces. Evidence can be any resource - document, artefact - anything needed for executing the Public Service.

description.nl: Geeft omschrijving van de vereiste input
An output can be any resource - document, artefact - anything produced by the Public Service.

usage.nl: In some cases, the Output of one Public Service will be used as evidence to fulfil a normal requirement of another Public Service. Such relationships should be described in the associated Rule(s).

description.nl: This model recognises a common role connected with public services, i.e. the Competent Authority.
A free text description of the Participation.

Provides the role played. This should be provided using a controlled vocabulary. Since this is an extension mechanism for the CSPV-AP, the controlled vocabulary should be decided to suit local implementations.
Een organisatie die volgens een wettelijk kader behoort tot de publieke sector,ongeacht het bestuursniveau waarop dat kader van kracht is.

usage.nl: OPMERKING: Als de PubliekeOrganisatie een officieel geregistreerde Organisatie is kan ze bijkomend gedefineerd worden als GeregistreerdeOrganisatie (zie elders in deze specificatie voor een definitie van deze term).

description.nl: Administratief gebied dat de Publieke Organisatie dekt.
A normal requirement is an atomic requirement. Some criteria can be expressed with several atomic requirements.

usage.nl: Not all public services are needed or usable by everyone.

description.nl: This property represents the official Name of the Requirement.
A short explanation about the nature, attributes, uses or any other additional information that helps clarify the understanding of the Requirement being instantiated.

Een conceptuele publieke service beschrijft een mogelijke dienstverlening (Public Service) die door besturen kan aangeboden worden. Het kan gebruikt worden als sjabloon om een public service vast te leggen. Daarnaast wordt het gebruikt om verschillende ge

The Rule class represents a document that sets out the specific rules, guidelines or procedures that the Public Service follows. It includes the terms of service, licence, and authentication requirements of the Public Service.
This property represents the Name of the Rule.
This property represents a free text Description of the Rule.

The Agent class is any resource that acts or has the power to act. This includes people, organizations and groups. The Public Organization class, defined in the Public Organization model, is a notable subclass of Agent.

This class represents the contact information for a Public Service, Channel, Public Organization, etc. It is defined in the Core Public Organization Vocabulary and is provided as a schema:ContactPoint.
Adres dat men kan aanschrijven of bezoeken.
A property through which a phone number for the Public Organization, or a representative of it, can be contacted.
The value of this property is structured text that gives the hours at which the contact point is normally available.

usage.nl: Days are specified using two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su. For example, if the contact point is open Monday-Friday, 9 -5, the value of the openingHours property would be Mo-Fr 09:00-17:00.

description.nl: A property through which an e-mail address for the Public Organization, or a representative of it, can be contacted.
A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.
